page.title: 02STH WINGFIELD MAIN FEATURES
page.content:
The most notable building in our survey area is{Wingfield Manor.} There has been a house on this site since Norman times although the present building is sixteenth century. It is partly in ruins. The tower with a circular stone staircase provides clear views over the countryside. The Manor was partly destroyed in the Civil War. It is famous because it was owned by Bess of Hardwick (Countess of Shrewsbury) and used to imprison Mary, Queen of Scots. It was the focal point of the so_called "Babbington Plot".
The village church of South Wingfield "All Saints", is also of Norman origin and has a square bell tower.
